ACTOR2: Civilians (Republic of Congo)
NOTES: In Republic of Congo, a grenade exploded this afternoon inside a pilot school in the Plateau des Quinze Ans ward, close to the general hospital in Brazzaville. Seven children were killed on the spot by the grenade, while seven others are in a serious condition. The victims are aged between nine and 12. The real circumstances of the tragedy are not yet known.

CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: RCD-Goma: Rally for Congolese Democracy (Goma) Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Two RCD men of the Goma faction, one RCD man of Kisangani and a Rwandan soldier were killed when they attempted to assassinate recently ousted RCD leader Wamba. The attack was stopped and the attempted assassins killed by Ugandan Soldiers. There was a sh BBC Monitoring Africa

ACTOR2: Military Forces of Uganda (1986-)
NOTES: Two RCD men of the Goma faction, one RCD man of Kisangani and a Rwandan soldier were killed when they attempted to assassinate recently ousted RCD leader Wamba. The attack was stopped and the attempted assassins killed by Ugandan Soldiers. There was a shoot-out after the attempt in the city that lasted for hours. Rwandan soldiers were also deployed to try to control the situation.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: RCD-Goma: Rally for Congolese Democracy (Goma) Military Forces of Uganda (1986-) Two RCD men of the Goma faction, one RCD man of Kisangani and a Rwandan soldier were killed when they attempted to assassinate recently ousted RCD leader Wamba. The attack was stopped and the attempted assassins killed by Ugandan Soldiers. There was a shoot-out after the attempt in the city that lasted for hours. Rwandan soldiers were also deployed to try to control the situation. BBC Monitoring Africa

NOTES: Prof Ernest Wamba dia Wamba's RCD [Congolese Rally for Democracy]-Kisangani rebel faction has elected a rival governor for Nord-Kivu province. This is creating tensions as RCD-Goma rebel faction led by Dr Emile Ilunga has appointed Kanyamuhanga Gafundi as the governor of Nord-Kivu.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: RCD-K: Rally for Congolese Democracy (Kisangani)  Prof Ernest Wamba dia Wamba's RCD [Congolese Rally for Democracy]-Kisangani rebel faction has elected a rival governor for Nord-Kivu province. This is creating tensions as RCD-Goma rebel faction led by Dr Emile Ilunga has appointed Kanyamuhanga Gafundi as the governor of Nord-Kivu. BBC Monitoring Service: Africa

ACTOR1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
ACTOR2: FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
NOTES: Armed Forces of the DRC troops on 6 August recovered the locality of Bukonde, 20 km from Mpeti in Walikale territory in Nord-Kivu Province. Bukonde locality served to gather Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda [FDLR] combatants in Walikale territory. The toll put to 27 FDLR combatants killed in two days, 11 captured and several guns recovered, said FARDC spokesman, Leon Richard Kasonga.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) FDLR: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda Armed Forces of the DRC troops on 6 August recovered the locality of Bukonde, 20 km from Mpeti in Walikale territory in Nord-Kivu Province. The toll put to 27 FDLR combatants killed in two days, 11 captured and several guns recovered, said FARDC spokesman, Leon Richard Kasonga. BBC Monitoring

The victims of the attack then responded with an arson attack of their own.

ACTOR1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)
ACTOR2: Lobala Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Democratic Republic of Congo forces exchanged fire on Sunday with around 100 tribal insurgents in Mbandaka in Equateur. A UN soldier from Ghana was killed. The assailants received support from former soldiers of the DSP (Praetorian Guard of late President Mobutu), elements of the former army of Zaire, the DPP (personal bodyguards of former Deputy President Jean-Pierre Bemba currently in detention at the International Criminal Court) and a few demobilized persons. The assailants also claim to be part of the Liberation Movement of Independent Allies, whose chairman is Ibrahim Mangbama and its military chief Undjani, a son of Ibrahim. These names were mentioned at the start of the insurrection in Dongo in October 2009.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-) Lobala Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo) Democratic Republic of Congo forces exchanged fire on Sunday with around 100 tribal insurgents in Mbandaka in Equateur. ACTOR2: Civilians (Angola)
NOTES: Alberto Chakusanga, a presenter on an Angolan radio station critical of the government, was found shot dead in his home in Luanda on 5 September. He is the first journalist to be murdered in Angola since 2001. Chakusanga, 31, hosted a programme on Radio Despertar, a station that was founded in 2002 as a result of the peace accords between the ruling MPLA and the opposition UNITA. The station supported UNITA.

ACTOR2: Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo)
NOTES: Oct. 2 -- At least 30 women were kept as prisoners in a dungeon-like structure and gang-raped over several weeks at the Congo and Angola border before being left naked in scrubland. According to The Scotsman, the United Nations Office for the Co-ordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) said that over 150 Congolese nationals arrived in Bandundu Province in southwestern Congo after being expelled from Angola. Congolese frequently cross the border to work as labourers in the mining districts that line the boundary between the two nations in Central Africa. OCHA spokeswoman Stefania Trassari said the men in the group were brutalized and at least 30 of the women were repeatedly raped when they were expelled from the country earlier this month. The deportees told the UN that Angolan authorities held them in a dingy building, and added that at least three were killed, including two men and a 27-year-old woman, after being raped repeatedly.
CONSOLIDATED_NOTES: Police Forces of Angola (1975-) Civilians (Democratic Republic of Congo) Oct. 2 -- At least 30 women were kept as prisoners in a dungeon-like structure and gang-raped over several weeks at the Congo and Angola border before being left naked in scrubland. Congolese frequently cross the border to work as labourers in the mining districts that line the boundary between the two nations in Central Africa. NOTES: Some 100 Angolans took to the streets Saturday in central Luanda to demand recognition and compensation for a 1977 ruling party purge that killed several thousands in the wake of a failed coup.The march was organized by the May 27 Foundation, which wants the government to launch an inquiry into the events surrounding May 27, 1977, when two senior members of the ruling MPLA led a failed uprising against then-president Agostinho Neto.
